Left Statement: I do not have an unhealthy curiosity and I don’t like to show my ignorance by asking questions.
Right Statement: My curiosity is insatiable; I want to know about everything and I am constantly asking questions.

Left Statement: I find subjects like philosophy quite boring.
Right Statement: I have a strong interest in stimulating ideas, theories, and philosophies.

Left Statement: Who cares about the ‘why’ of things? I am only interested in the ‘how’ of things that I have to do.
Right Statement: I am always trying to find out the ‘why’ of things.

Left Statement: I do not like to poke my nose into others affairs.
Right Statement: I am very interested in studying people and their motives and behaviour.

Left Statement: I really enjoy food, clothing, ‘action’ films or competitive sports more than anything else.
Right Statement: I enjoy most many of the delicate and fine things of life, such as literature, music, art, flowers, interior decoration, etc.

Left Statement: I feel quite uncomfortable without company.
Right Statement: I don’t usually crave for company but I enjoy meeting interesting and sensitive people.

Left Statement: One can’t care for every one. I care mainly for my family members and friends.
Right Statement: I am often touched deeply by the misery of strangers.

Left Statement: I am primarily interested in the usefulness of things.
Right Statement: Beauty and elegance of things move me even more deeply than their usefulness.

Left Statement: I tend to solve problems by systematic, step-by-step logic and analysis.
Right Statement: I tend to skip steps and leap intuitively to correct solutions.

Left Statement: I don’t waste time in visions and dreams; I believe in being down to earth.
Right Statement: I often have visions about the kind of society we should have, the kind of work people should be doing, my own role, etc.

Left Statement: I am a solid person and hold only very respectable ideas.
Right Statement: Some people think I am crazy because my ideas are so strange.

Left Statement: I have a pretty balanced temperament.
Right Statement: I am a moody person and I have my highs and lows, elations and depressions.

Left Statement: I tend to be rather cautious in risky situations.
Right Statement: I love to take calculated risks

Left Statement: I prefer to work on ventures or projects led by solid, dependable persons.
Right Statement: I prefer to start ventures and projects of my own.

Left Statement: I am a realist; I pursue only those goals I can attain soon and successfully.
Right Statement: I know I may never reach some of my goals but I still pursue them.

Left Statement: I like to go along with others.
Right Statement: I rather like striking out on my own.

Left Statement: I seldom ever question whatever is well-established.
Right Statement: I do have a strong tendency to question the established order of things.

Left Statement: I don’t really stick rigidly to any core convictions or values.
Right Statement: I stick to a few core convictions and values, come what may.

Left Statement: One can’t know everything; I mostly rely on experts’ opinions.
Right Statement: I may hear out what an expert has to say but I make up my own mind and have my own ideas.

Left Statement: There is much virtue in being cautious when it comes to expressing one’s views and feelings.
Right Statement: I make no bones about where I stand; I assert my viewpoint and feelings clearly and forcefully.

Left Statement: It is upto my superiors to tell me the restrictions within which I have to work.
Right Statement: I take the initiative to identify clearly the restrictions within which I am expected to work.

Left Statement: I feel pretty upset in crisis situations and this badly affects my functioning.
Right Statement: I feel pretty confident that I can manage any crisis.

Left Statement: I have a hard time coping with change of any sort.
Right Statement: I can adjust very quickly to new challenges, problems, and information.

Left Statement: I hate to live in a world of fantasies and wishful thinking.
Right Statement: I really enjoy having fantasies but I don’t lose my grip over reality.

Left Statement: I do not shirk work but it certainly is not my whole life.
Right Statement: I get wholly preoccupied with challenging tasks.

Left Statement: There is always so much one doesn’t know; I often feel quite diffident in unfamiliar situations.
Right Statement: I am quite confident of my abilities even in unfamiliar situations.

Left Statement: I know my limitations—I take on only those tasks I can achieve comfortably.
Right Statement: I have a tendency to take on really difficult tasks most would avoid.

Left Statement: I tend to avoid ventures that demand too much commitment of my time and energy.
Right Statement: I tend to persist in my ventures to the point that others think I am obsessed.
